@Reconstructor_2D/recon_qual.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 % =========================================================================
00002 %> @brief recon_qual calculates norms for image (permittivity distribution),
00003 %> sensitivity matrix and measurement
00004 %> recon_qual calculates norms for image (permittivity distribution),
00005 %> sensitivity matrix and measurement
00006 %> the discrepancy (normalized square norm)
00007 %> 1. between numerical phantom or model and reconstructed image
00008 %> 2. between sensitivity matrix for phantom and sensitivity 
00009 %>    matrix for solution estimate
00010 %> 3. between measured values and reprojected using current solution estimate
00011 %> 
00012 %> @param Ep_Pha  permittivity distribution of numerical phantom or model
00013 %> @param S_Pha   sensitivity matrix calculated for phantom or model
00014 %> @param Cm      measurements - real values
00015 %> @param Ep_0    permittivity distribution of initial (start) solution Ep(0)
00016 %> @param S_0     sensitivity matrix calculated for initial solution Ep(0)
00017 %> @param Cr_0    measurements - reprojected values for initial solution Ep(0)
00018 %> @param Ep      permittivity distribution - current solution estimate Ep(i)
00019 %> @param S       sensitivity matrix calculated for current solution estimate S(i)
00020 %> @param Cr      measurements - reprojected values for current solution Ep(i)
00021 %> @param scale   '2one' to scaling to 1 or 'norm' to normalize
00022 %>
00023 %> @retval Cap_err   vector of normalized L2 distance in measurement domain
00024 %> @retval Imag_err  vector of normalized L2 distance in image domain
00025 %> @retval Sens_err  vector of normalized L2 distance between models
00026 % =========================================================================
00027 function [Cap_err Imag_err Sens_err] = recon_qual (rec_obj,Ep_Pha, S_Pha, Cm, ... 
00028                                                    Ep_0,   S_0,   Cr_0, ...
00029                                                    Ep,     S,     Cr, scale)
00030                                                           
00031 % matrices should be reshaped to vectors! or call sum(sum(A));
00032 
00033 if strcmp(scale,'2one')==1
00034 
00035     Cap_err  = sum(sum((Cr-Cm).^2))/sum(sum((Cr_0-Cm).^2));
00036     
00037     Imag_err = sum(sum((Ep-Ep_Pha).^2))/sum(sum((Ep_0-Ep_Pha).^2));
00038 
00039     Sens_err = sum(sum((S-S_Pha).^2))/sum(sum((S_0-S_Pha).^2));    
00040 
00041 elseif strcmp(scale,'norm')==1
00042 
00043     Cap_err  = sum(sum((Cr-Cm).^2))/sum(sum((Cm).^2));
00044 
00045     Imag_err  = sum(sum((Ep-Ep_Pha).^2))/sum(sum((Ep_Pha).^2));
00046 
00047     Sens_err = sum(sum((S-S_Pha).^2))/sum(sum((S_Pha).^2));
00048 
00049 else
00050     disp 'ERR: unknown parameter for reconstruction error scaling mode';
00051     return;
00052 end
